title: (x) what is this font in this logo? - Agenda Condensed, Kari, Chalet New York 1970 {self (Jennifer P), Akira}
content: Does anyone know what the 3 fonts here are? There's the "ESPRIT" running vertically, the "MIAMI", and the font in the tagline "OUR FLOWERS MEAN BUSINESS". If anyone knows what any of these are, just one even will help. Thank you so much!!
author: jperrella4

comments.content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130627014623im_/http:/typophile.com/files/esprit_logo_flat_5540.jpg)

here's the logo to go with the first post, sorry!

the closest I've come to is Trebuchet. I thought it might be Fruitger, but that font has flats on the tops of the "M", and the above doesn't. And the "R" in Futura is different so that's out too. The "E" on Trebuchet though has even length top & bottom horizontal lines, where as the "E" above has a slightly longer bottom line than the top one. Uggh, help! Thanks!
okay, i's not Trebuchet either. The lines in the "F" in Flowers are equal length in the logo tagline, and the 'F' in Trebuchet has a shorter bottom length leg. Sorry, I don't know the correct terms!
After going through the Identifont.com process, I think it's Agenda Condensed.
does anyone know what the decorative letters are, or the "MIAMI" letters?
